body:
### Problem

Joining multiple lines with each of them ending with `>` will join them and leave only one `>`.

### Steps to reproduce

Open neovim with the following command.

```
nvim -u NONE
```

Write the following:

```
>
>
>
```

Select all lines and join them by typing in normal mode `ggVGJ`. The file now contains:
```
>
```

### Expected behavior

After this command, the file should contain the three `>` in one line.

It should ever be like that if it follows the behaviour when joining `)`.

```
>>>
```

Or it should be like that if it follows the behaviour for other characters.

```
> > >
```

### Neovim version (nvim -v)

NVIM v0.9.5

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

I did not test it.

### Operating system/version

Linux Mint 21.2

### Terminal name/version

Terminal MATE 1.26.0

### $TERM environment variable

xterm-256color

### Installation

Ubuntu packages maintained by Ubuntu Developers

comment_data.body:
> I did not test it. 

Then please test it. That field is there for a reason. 

(If the chevron is considered as a comment marker, this is expected default behavior and cam be controlled by options.)

> Then please test it. That field is there for a reason.

The problem does not appear with this version.

```
+autocmd           -clipboard         -diff              -float             -keymap            +modify_fname      +multi_byte        -profile           -sound             -terminal          +vim9script        +xfontset

Y_VIMRC -D_REENTRANT -U_FORTIFY_SOURCE -D_FORTIFY_SOURCE=1
Linking: gcc -Wl,-Bsymbolic-functions -flto=auto -ffat-lto-objects -flto=auto -Wl,-z,relro -Wl,-z,now -Wl,--as-needed -o vim -lSM -lICE -lXpm -lXt -lX11 -lXdmcp -lSM -lICE -lm -ltinfo -lselinux -lacl -lattr
```

The result is:

```
> > >
```

> Duplicate of #16017

I confirm that `>` is in `comments`.

```
comments=s1:/*,mb:*,ex:*/,://,b:#,:%,:XCOMM,n:>,fb:
```

Thanks both of you for your support.

labels.description: issues that are closed as duplicates of other issues
labels.name: closed:duplicate

title: Joining multiple lines ending with `>` will collapse them
